subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Eliza Dane 
 
 
 Mr. Eliza i am satisfied receiving your receipt of email and with your email i can confirmed dealing with the real foreign beneficiary of the said Funds deposited in an Online Offshore Account of our Central Bank of Nigeria possession as the only Remitting Bank in Nigeria that can remit foreign Funds to the said foreign beneficiary, Mr. Eliza as you must known now your Funds value the sum of $6.5 Million USD and the Government of Nigeria has order you as the foreign beneficiary to kindly claim your Funds from the Bank. Your Funds has been with the Central Bank of Nigeria since last September and it unfortunate you didn't contacted us for your Funds re claiming before now but all the same we appreciate receive your response today. 
 Claiming your Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD required all attentions from you, because already there is no limited time to waste in claiming this Funds from the Bank, so therefore i will guide and advise you are to contact the Central Bank of Nigeria Foreign Remittance Office which Mr Folashodun A Shonub head that department, to achieve the process to access your $6.5 Million USD through Online you must contact his Office and comply with all directive for you to easy claim your Funds to your own Bank Account in your country without any delays. I have attached the FUNDS RELEASE ORDER PAYMENT LETTER AND MY DRIVER LICENSE in this email for you to view and be rest assured how guarantee this Funds was approved by the President of Nigeria himself. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Dear Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I understand that there is a sum of money in an Online Offshore Account of the Central Bank of Nigeria that has been approved by the President of Nigeria himself for me to claim.

However, I would like to clarify a few things before we proceed. Could you please provide more details about this fund? How did it come to be in my name? What are the necessary steps I need to take in order to claim this fund?

I look forward to your prompt response.

Best wishes,
Regina

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Dear Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your email. I am glad to hear that the Nigerian government has approved my funds. However, I would like to clarify a few things before we proceed.

Firstly, could you please provide more details about this fund? How did it come into existence and why was it assigned to me? 

Secondly, could you please explain the process of claiming these funds in more detail? What are the steps I need to take and what kind of information do you need from me?

Lastly, I would appreciate if you could provide some official documentation or proof that verifies the existence of this fund and its assignment to me.

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Regina

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Dear Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your email. I am pleased to hear that the Nigerian government has approved my funds. However, I would like to clarify a few things before we proceed.

Firstly, could you please provide more details about these funds? How did they come into my possession and why are they being held by the Central Bank of Nigeria?

Secondly, could you please explain the process of claiming these funds in more detail? What steps do I need to take and what information do I need to provide?

Lastly, could you please confirm that this is not a scam? I have heard many stories about people being tricked into sending money or personal information in order to claim non-existent funds.

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Regina

subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (VIEW THOSE TWO ATTACHED DOCUMENT IN THIS EMAIL)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Eliza Dane 
 
 
 
 Good morning Foreign beneficiary Eliza from the United Kingdom (UK) I received your and i appreciate your question knowing more about your Funds deposited in an Online Offshore Account of the Central Bank of Nigerian Possession, i have attached two important Certificate which explained how this Funds was related to you and while you definitely need to act fast to claim the Funds to avoid losing the Funds, so i advise you as the Honorable Minister to make claiming your Funds as the only related person to this Funds your priority, because as it is stated inthere in the President Letter the Funds is been related to you is the hard labored of your forefather who live in Nigeria doing the colonial era and for more than six decades the Funds had been in the Central Bank of Nigeria possession thanks to this new era Government in Nigeria who has instructed and order for the release of all foreign Funds to the Funds owner. 
 
 On all your questions i will be answering them only if you can comply by forwarding more of your details such as the following below. 
 
 Direct Cell Phone Number: 
 International Passport: 
 Age: 
 Occupation: 
 Next of Kin's: 
 This information is vital if any further information will be released to you from my Office on claiming the Funds, kindly view those two attached documents in this email. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (VIEW THOSE TWO ATTACHED DOCUMENT IN THIS EMAIL)
body:
Dear Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your prompt response. I am indeed interested in claiming the funds related to my forefather's hard labor during the colonial era in Nigeria.

Here are the details you requested:

Next of Kin: Mr. John Dane (Brother)

I look forward to your guidance on the next steps to claim these funds.

Best wishes,
Regina

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (VIEW THOSE TWO ATTACHED DOCUMENT IN THIS EMAIL)
body:
Dear Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your prompt response. I am indeed interested in claiming the funds related to my forefather. However, before proceeding further, I would like to clarify a few things.

Firstly, could you please provide more details about my forefather who lived in Nigeria during the colonial era? It would be helpful to know his name and any other relevant information that could help me establish this connection.

Secondly, I understand from your email that these funds have been held by the Central Bank of Nigeria for over six decades. Could you please explain why they were not released earlier?

Lastly, regarding the details you requested - my next of kin is my son, John Dane. Please let me know if you need any additional information about him.

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Regina

subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (CONTACT THE REMITTING BANK..... BANK CONTACTS DETAILS IS BELOW)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Eliza Dane 
 
 
 
 
I appreciate your receipt of email and the details which was received from you as your next of kin's is okay, your brother John which stand as your next of kin's is okay us, listen and understand that your Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD had been deposited in the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) possession as the only remitting Bank to remit Funds to foreigner in he/her own nominated Bank Account in your country, regarding your email which you stated you are sincerely ready to proceed with the re claiming of this Funds Beneficiary Eliza i will urge and advise you to contact the CBN Governor Office through the Bank details below. 
 
 CBN GOVERNOR EMAIL:cbngovernoroffice01@accountant.com 
CBN GOVERNOR: Mr Olayemi Michael Cardoso 
 
Kindly contact his Office because we have submitted your Funds file to his desk yesterday for him to be aware of you the British citizen who own this Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD is available in claiming his/her Funds. This is the only guarantee Funds which you will be claiming it without any illegal act or activities. Please due forward your direct cell phone number and your DRIVER LICENSE as well please is essenital for the CBN to know you in person before any further procedure on claiming your Funds. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS
